fields.description: There is no way to recreate the field if it is removed.
fields.summary: If the Flagged field is removed, you can no longer use the feature

fields.description:
# Error message title is not required
# Warning message layout is off because there is no title
fields.summary: Message layout could be improved

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

# Create a project which allows anonymous users to edit/browse issues
# Browse to a board of that board anonymously (do not log in)
# Attempt to flag an issue

The error message is not consistent in the case when you do not have permission to edit the issue. But when you do have edit permission it does not allow you to flag the issue which inhibits the feature from working.
fields.summary: Incorrect error message when attempting to flag an issue as anonymous user

fields.description:
If you have multiple options for your Flagged field, and the first one is 'disabled', then when you flag an issue it should use the first non-disabled option.

Make sure that the detection of valid options (when checking to see if flagging can be done at all) also checks for enabled options instead of just any options existing.
fields.summary: Flag value is set to an option that is 'disabled' in the custom field configuration

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

# Using default JIRA workflow, move an issue to 'Closed'
# Attempt to flag issue

The error message should say that the issue is not editable, and not that the issues in the project are not editable.
fields.summary: Incorrect error message when attempting to flag an issue which is not editable due to workflow status

fields.description:
Affects JIRA 5.1 (not sure about JIRA 5.2).

Need to change which size avatar we are requesting from JIRA from {{small}} to {{xsmall}}. This is what happens in JIRA 6.0.
fields.summary: User avatar in comments section of Detail View obscures the user name

fields.description: If it does we can use this instead of get to avoid the long URL problem
fields.summary: Investigate whether Excel export works with post

fields.description: On the client version there were "On the Fly" filters. I could chose "On the Fly" and filter the page according to anything I wanted. Issue type, Issue Status, Developer etc... In this new OnDemand version I have to write a quick filter for everything, which isnt great. Please bring back the "On the Fly" filters.
fields.summary: Bring back "On the Fly" filters ASAP

fields.description: For Boards with a lot of Quick Filters predefined, it would be handy to be able to hide them, as the huge bar on top of the Board can distort the display in small screens. Alternatively, Quick Filters could be hidden when _Hide the header_ button is hit.
fields.summary: Ability to hide Quick Filters

fields.description:
It would be nice to create the filers where we can extract the data based on Scrum Boards. For ex,
Scrum Board: XYZ-1
Sprint: Sprint-1
From above board and sprint I would like to see issues based on status, assignee and etc.
fields.summary: Ability to search issues in JQL using Rapid Board name

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to switch between boards when accessing one of the boards, as it would minimize the number of clicks required to go to another board (currently it is necessary to go Agile -> View All Boards -> Select the new board).
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to switch between boards when accessing one

fields.description:
It would be nice if we have a burndown that could show the burn in points, with the option to display hours as well or as a separate chart if time tracking is enabled. 

Today, we have to choose between seeing a burndown with story points or tracking time on sub-tasks because the burndown goes to hours only if you enable time tracking.
fields.summary: Burndown with Points AND Hours
Option to customise the Parent Bar when using Stories for swimlanes

fields.description:
The progress bars on versions on the classic planning boards was more useful than on the new planning board, simply because it contained more information.
For example:
* grey bar = no issues assigned to version
* red bar = issue to be done
* yellow bar = issues in progress
* green bar = issues done

This was very useful, but has been removed on the progress bars of the new board, which only consist of a blue progress.
I attached two screenshots:
New:
!new.jpg!

Classic:
!classic.jpg!

Also there is no progress bar for "unscheduled" anymore, which was also useful.

Please bring this back!
fields.summary: Enhance Version/Epic progress bar in planning mode

fields.description:
After the changes in JIRA 6.0, our planning board has 60% of the width for the backlog, issues are squashed at the right side.

This involves a lot of scrolling when working with issues in the planning board.

Also, TWO scroll bars? Seriously?

Please revert the planning board to the state before JIRA 6.0 or give me at least an opportunity to resize the issue "column"
fields.summary: Plan Mode: Issue Details much too narrow
Update to latest version of Selenium / WebDriver
JIRAIFrameAction Reflected XSS

fields.description: When creating an issue from within an epic the creation screen defaults to the last project whether it matches the epic or not. Customers would like this to default to the parent project of the epic.
fields.summary: Default the project for a new issue to the project of the Epic it is created within

fields.description: Prior to using the Quick Filter, the 2nd swimlane in the board is collapsed. After engaging the filter, a different issue (which is now in the #2 position) is now collapsed. The lanes should stay expanded or collapsed based on identity, not location to follow the principle of least surprise.
fields.summary: When I activate or deactivate a quick filter, swimlanes will expand or collapse on their own

fields.description:
Sometime the issue can contain long description, which may require increase the  Detail View Width, so would be great if this is possible since it will add more flexibility.


Currently the Detail View is smaller than the pervious versions which can cause readability issues
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to adjust Detail View Width on the 'Plan' mode since is smaller than the previous versions

fields.description:
When the scrum board is basing swimlanes on assignees, the headings show the assignee's name and the number of issues they have.  

It'd be great if the headings also showed the sum of the remaining estimate assigned to that person because it'd help my team spot when someone is overloaded.
fields.summary: Add remaining estimate sum to owner headings on scrum board

fields.description:
When we're planning a sprint, it'd be nice to have a visible chart that shows how much work is assigned to each person so that we can more easily spot over or under loading.  

Right now we find ourselves having to track that on paper during the meeting.
fields.summary: Add some way to judge load across the team to planning board
Epic lozenge is showing & in issue sidebar

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Use a board like the "Basic" board
# Add some issues to epic "BASIC-96"
# View that issue in JIRA
fields.summary: Issues added to epic do not display in box

fields.description:
When we create custom fields we store their id in the database. The code loading the fields checks for their existence, and if not available we assume the field has been deleted and we recreate it.

The problem is that the CustomFieldManager might tell us a field is not available when in reality it is. Implement an additional db layer check whenever we have a custom field id stored but CFM doesn't return us the field. If we find the relevant entry in the database than throw an Exception instead of recreating the field
fields.summary: Perform database existence checks before recreating custom fields

fields.description: Different members of our team like different views of the scrum board.  I prefer to view based on "Story" swimlanes but some members of the team prefer "Assignee" swimlanes.  It'd be great if the selection of view was per-user rather than per board.
fields.summary: Let users see different views of scrum board

fields.description: As a user, I want to be able to set start and end date for planned sprint instead of just the sprint that is going to be started. This would allow better planning.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to set start and end date for planned sprint

fields.description:
Original summary: GreenHopper misuses the concepts of "epics" and "themes"
--

An _epic_ is a placeholder for a collection of user stories that will eventually be defined (this has to happen before they're added to a sprint). Epics can be prioritized in the Product Backlog, along with all the other Product Backlog Items.

A _theme_ is a coherent set of user stories -- Often the resulting user stories from an epic. You can't prioritize a theme per se, because its Product Backlog Items may not necessarily be in a consecutive order.

GreenHopper is mixing the two concepts, leading to the following issues:
# You can't prioritize an epic (the issue type) in the Product Backlog. They don't even show up in the Product Backlog.
# The "epic" functionality is in some aspects confusing and cumbersome, because it mainly deals with themes, while also assuming that epic = theme. One consequence is having a redundant "Epic Status" field that users must somehow keep in sync with the "Status" field. 
# You get a separate pseudo backlog for "epics", which allows you to prioritize them. This doesn't mean anything in Scrum.

Older versions of JIRA/GreenHopper used to get these two things right, albeit with an interface that wasn't as helpful as the new Rapid Boards: Themes were a type of label and epics could be prioritized.
fields.summary: Ability to view and prioritise epics in the backlog

fields.description:
From the customer:

{quote}
Hi,
I upgraded GH to 6.2.1 and I really like the new look-and-feel!
However, the tiny icons in the Agile menu that indicates the type of board has disappeared.
(see attachment) 
Is this supposed? I have seen in a demo video on your web-page that they should probably be there! 
Most of our teams work with both types of boards and it would be great if they didn't have to indicated board type in the name of the board.
{quote}
fields.summary: Agile menu icons is missing

fields.description: When refining large stories we need to create smaller stories for which the epic is already known. But when creating or reviewing a story using the card view of the story I cannot directly add it to an epic. I first have to switch to the planning board which means that I loose my context.
fields.summary: As a user I want to add an issue to an epic when displaying the the issue card so that I don't need to open a planning board and loose my work context

fields.description:
Currently the section "Issues in Epic" displays the issues but as user I cannot quickly change the sort orders of these items (like it is possible for section attachments).

Sorting the issues would be helpful to get quickly an overview of the Epic. I like to do this with as few mouse clicks as possible.
fields.summary: As a user I want to sort the issues in Epic by resolution, status or assignee so that I can quickly view get an overview of the progress in the Epic

fields.description:
h2. Issue

Currently the Epic card list has a section "Issues in Epic" but the sorting of those issues cannot be sorted by status or resolution or assignee.

Sorting would be helpful to quickly get an overview of the Epic. So I like to do this with as few mouse clicks as possible.
fields.summary: Add a link from the View Issue page of an Epic which shows the "Issues in Epic" in Issue Navigator

fields.description: When viewing an Epic and looking at the "Issues in Epic" section I would like to see the resolution of closed issues.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the resolution of issues when viewing the Epic

fields.description:
As a rapid board owner, I can create new columns in my work board to model my development process, which is great.

The consequence of this is that an additional status is added to the list of statuses, which I can understand.

When some owner is experimenting with his board configuration, you end up with a long list of statusses such as 'test', 'under test', 'in validation', 'sdfjqsfdmjkl' ...
Note - only users who have 'project admin' permission can create new statuses, but this was a permission only granted to 'jira administrators' in the past.  In our configurations, project admins are not jira admins.

So - request - there must be a way to limit the list of users who should be able to create statuses or columns, or at least notify the user that  a new global entity (status) will be created which will affect the complete instance ...
fields.summary: Ability to define permission to create status via Simplified Workflow
Update alignments of issue and story swimlane parent

fields.description:
- Add field to default screen
- Change description of field
fields.summary: Create upgrade task to handle epic link field changes

fields.description:
- Remove post function of dialog that handled epic association
- Prefill epic link field with epic in which an issue is being created
fields.summary: Modify create issue in epic dialog to play nice with epic link field

fields.description:
{panel}
*Original Description*

When editing an epic name within GH I am limited to the number of characters I can enter. However, when I edit an epic name within JIRA I do not have a limitation. At a minimum I would expect the behavior to be the same in either place. I would prefer to not be character limited.
{panel}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an agile board for Scrum and go to the backlog section
 # Create an "Epic" and give it a good long name (more than 30 chars)
 # Click the menu on the Epic in the Backlog view of the board, and choose "edit name"
 # Change the "Epic name" so it has less than 30 characters
 # Try to change the name again, attempting to make it more than 30 characters

h3. Expected Results

Able to change the Epic Name to more than 30 characters in both, Epic Panel and Issue View screen
h3. Actual Results

Editing through the Epic Panel limits the Epic Name to 30 characters.
fields.summary: Epic name character limit exists in GH but not JIRA

fields.description: In the sprint report, the chart displayed is way too little and it would be a great feature to enlarge the chart.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to view a bigger chart in the Sprint report

fields.description: It would be useful to see a 'burndown chart' for the entire project, not only for a sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to view a burndown chart for the entire project

fields.description:
With parallel Sprints coming up, a board can contain a ton of ongoing sprints at the same time.  It'd be nice to have a way to hide the Sprint filters, see screenshot:
!Screen_Shot_2013-05-16_at_11.35.06_AM.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Include option to hide Sprints in Work Mode

fields.description:
Currently I have to manually add swimlanes by query

{quote}"Epic Link" = __________{quote}

This requires continual maintenance as new epics are added to my project.  It should be simple to create swimlanes by Epic (or as Jira/Greenhopper calls it, "Epic Link").

Apologies if this is a duplicate request; I did not find it in any search results.
fields.summary: As a user/admin, I would like an option to create scrum board swimlanes according to Epic ("Epic Link")

fields.description:
we are using values like 3.5 in our story point field and sometimes they appear and sometimes not. So when we edit the story is shows the 3.5.
in the issue the 3.5 is truncated to 3 when displayed. when displayed in the 
Rapid release board it shows 3.5. when it is exported to excel it is a 3. 

this is a major problem for us how can it be fixed? 

I have attached slides showing the different screens 

Janeen
fields.summary: when we have story points with floating points - like 3.5 or the like the value get truncated

fields.description:
As of now, it is the default behavior for the sub-task to inherit the *Fix Version/s* field from the parent issue as we can see from [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6072] and the current workaround is to remove the project from the projects 'Enabled for GreenHopper' in the GreenHopper configuration. You should find it no longer inherits the parent fix version as mentioned by Shaun Clowes. Looking from a different perspective, is it possible to have an option to choose whether this can be optional or not?

Perhaps some sort of of *checkbox* in *GreenHopper* that says something like?
* Inherit *Fix Version/s* from Parent Issue for sub-task (/) (x)
fields.summary: Option to disable / enable Fix Version/s field inheritance from parent ticket when creating sub-task
"Days remaining in Sprint" in Sprint Health gadget doesn't work for 7 working days

fields.description: I've found times where sprints were started accidentally and we need to add stories to the sprint (as part of the commitment) and times where sprints were closed accidentally and we need to close stories before we completed the sprint because the work was done.
fields.summary: As an administrator of a project, I need to be able to edit sprint contents as our velocity doesn't accurately represent the work that was done

fields.description: Previously in Classic Statistic Burndown Gadget, it can be configured to show results for a Project or a Product. If the current Sprint Burndown gadget can be configured to have multiple sprints, it could show the progress of almost a complete product (which is the goal). Perhaps when it is configurable to multiple sprints, it also can be limited to a version.
fields.summary: Burndown Gadget to show multiple sprints or to Version burndown
Add confirmation/warning when releasing sub-tasks of parents that are in progress from a Kanban board

fields.description:
At the moment, when a user clicks on an issue from a sprint or the backlog, the detail of that issue will be shown on the _Issue Detail View_.  Then, if the user wants to view the issue, he/she will need to click on the issue link from the _Issue Detail View_.  

A configuration to directly view an issue (instead directing to Issue Detail View first) would be convenient for users.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to directly view an issue instead going to the Issue Detail view first on the Plan Mode

fields.description: 6850 chars for Chrome but I don't know how many for other browsers. We should check the char length after we build the URL and alert the user if it will be an invalid URL, rather than just leading them to a blank page.
fields.summary: Too many issues will overrun valid URL length per browser

fields.description:
Replications steps :
1) install HAL instance using fireball-220
2) log in as sysadmin
3) uninstall GH 
4) enable marketing plugin again (actually I'm not sure if this is a separate bug)
5) From within an admin context (e.g. /secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa or the Manage Add-ons page) click Project > Create Project > Agile Scrum > Enable GH
6) A JS is thrown
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Object function (){var G=null;if(arguments.length&&typeof arguments[0]=="string"){G=arguments.callee.$(document.createElement(arguments[0]));if(arguments.length==2){G.html(arguments[1])}}return G} has no method 'parseUri' 
{code}
fields.summary: GH Installation fails in admin context from marketing PT

fields.description: In test data, there are epics with the key BASIC-XXX but they aren't returned when I start typing "Epic Link"="B"
fields.summary: Matching epics not returned in the first 15 results are not considered

fields.description:
Scenario: I have a board with multiple statuses represented in one column. Assuming my workflow allows it, today I'm able to drag an item from one column to this other column, and I get multiple "drop zones" where I can put the issue, thereby giving it one of the many statuses represented in that column. 

The desired enhancement is that I can change an issue's status without moving it to a different column. For example, I have a column with "Open" and "Requires Clarification" statuses in it. My workflow allows an issue to go from "Requires Clarification" to "Open". When I select an issue in the "Requires Clarification" status, I'd want to see a drop zone appear in the same column allowing me to drop it into "Open".
fields.summary: As a user, I can change a ticket's status on the board by moving it to a different status within the same column

fields.description:
I would like the PDF report contain following information:

1. Sprint start date and end date
2. Sprint stories and their IDs
3. Graph of committed story points and actual for the sprint. l
4. Stories and tasks that are not completed
5. Pie chart of distribution of stories by epics
6. Changes in the sprint - stories added or deleted
7. A bar graph of last 3 or 4 sprint velocity and their duration.

The actual use case is to send such a report to executives when a sprint is concluded as status. One report will help the executives get what is happening in the sprint and if any corrections need to be taken. I see Jira/GH is well positioned to reduce burden on managers handling the project by bringing transparency and consistency in handling the projects. From my experience manager handling a project spends lot of time with communication and setting the stakeholders in sync.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like PDF report export capabilities

fields.description: According to our documentation on [Configuring Swimlanes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Swimlanes], it is possible to base swimlanes on Epics, however, this only applies to version 6.2.1, but the documentation states that is applicable to 6.2.x, which is incorrect. Please add this to the documentation, as customers can be confused.
fields.summary: Swimlanes per Epics is not working as documented

fields.description: Please allow the ability to manage and view sub-task from the sprint planning mode rapid board view. Sometimes it is required to split up work from a larger project and only account for a portion of the sub-task in a particular sprint. For that reason we need the ability to manage task and sub-task in the planning mode to ensure required issues are not accidentally left behind.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to access sub-tasks in sprint planning mode on rapid board

fields.description: The ability to have a history within GH, like on a JIRA ticket, would be helpful and allow for follow up if someone accidentally starts/finishes a sprint or rename the sprint.
fields.summary: Provide history for board and sprint activities
Resizable issue details window in GreenHopper

fields.description:
On the Sprint Burndown chart, it is very helpful to know whether the items are added to the Sprint (i.e. scope change) were resolved during the Sprint. 

Unlike other parts of JIRA, the issue key does not change to struckthrough text on the Sprint Burndown chart when the issue has been resolved.
fields.summary: Issue Key should reflect whether issue is resolved in Reports

fields.description: Currently, there is no method to include any form of notes in GreenHopper. This could come in useful, especially for situations where users would like to keep some notes regarding their sprints (for example, focus areas. estimations, what went well, what needs improvements, etc).
fields.summary: Allow insertion of notes into GreenHopper

fields.description:
In order to determine which Epic a story belongs to in GreenHopper Reports, you would have to go into the issue itself. 

It's helpful if Epic name is specified in the report too, for every story.
fields.summary: Show Epic name that a story belongs to in JIRA Software Reports

fields.description:
1. set GH configuration to only be enabled for a single project
2. Remove browse permission for that project for the current user (or all users)

Result: when clicking the Agile tab, the user is redirected to the Welcome page every time instead of going to their previous board. 

This is because we first check to see if the user has permission for any of the GH enabled projects (Classic!!) and if they don't we redirect to getting started. 

The fix is to do this check later on and let them try to go to a Rapid board if they have one stored.
fields.summary: Permission checking in GreenHopper.jspa is too aggressive

fields.description: It would be great if, instead of click in each parent issue in work mode on GreenHopper to check their status, we can view it in a column beside the issue. Today we have a column for the Issue Key, one showing how many sub-tasks it has and another showing the issue summary. We can have one before the issue summary showing the issue status.
fields.summary: Option to have a visual way to quickly view the parent issue status in Work Mode

fields.description:
The following statement was made by a user comprehensively. Hence, I decide to put everything here so that the devs will have a look into it:

{quote}
 I am really sorry I updated GreenHopper this time because I think Atlassian made a couple of really horrible UI changes. Amongst others:
* The version and epic panels are panels which are opened and closed many times during grooming and planning - even in the day to day work of a PO or SM.
** Electing to remove the button when it is pressed is bad enough but forcing users to then search *different* places on the screen (depending on the browser window size) to close them again is really really bad.
** Placing the close 'X' right next to the "create" label is just a consequence of this bad design.
** Why is there no keyboard shortcuts for these panels implemented at least? Question: How do I get keyboard shortcuts for this?
** In general having to hover the mouse pointer in various places on the screen to get an insight of what the possibilities are is considered bad UI design by many. Try hovering on a tablet?? See also [http://ui-patterns.com/blog/User-Interface-AntiPatterns] about anti-patterns.

What do I want:
* I want to have the buttons that *filter* my issues act the same. They should all act like the quick filters which do not disappear. That would be consistent and useful.
* I want to have keyboard shortcuts for these two important panels (and thanks for doing those in the first place btw.). ('p' and 'v' could be candidates)

It is evident that you are trying to make things look nice on a tablet - that is fine. But is is happening at the expense of where the tool is most often used: a browser on a PC with a proper keyboard and mouse. Please stop making things worse in the UI department.

Please see this as an opportunity to improve (fix UI mistakes) rather than a negative request to be ignored/archived. I have 100 users and we are working on scaling up to 500 on multiple sites so this is of some importance to my organisation that the UI is fast and usable.
{quote}

Perhaps someone can shed some light on the suggestions that the user has?
fields.summary: GreenHopper Keyboard Shortcuts and Non-moving buttons for Version and Epic Panels

fields.description:
As Diana and Patrick, I want to be exposed to the dot-dialog via the context menu so I can find new functionality I might otherwise struggle to find.

CoS:
- when a context menu is invoked *on a single issue only*, add an option to trigger the dot dialog
fields.summary: Add "more actions" to the context menu

fields.description:
As Diana I want to easily assign a card to myself when I'm in work mode so I don't waste time doing this common task.

CoS:

- "assign to me" is available in context menu in work mode
fields.summary: Add "assign to me" to context menu in work mode
Investigate what would need to change to allow Epic Link to be used on Bulk Edit wizard
Change view template of Epic Link field to show Epic Name as well

fields.description:
Autocomplete should show Epic Name and Epic Issue Key.

Potentially coordinate with GHS-8665 for a REST resource to query.
fields.summary: Epic Link template should use single select with autocomplete

fields.description: Allow input from user when creating an issue
fields.summary: Create Epic Link field

fields.description:
Take input from user - Epic issue key. Store as a link between the issue and the epic. 

Note: when editing an issue of type Epic, do not show the field in the form, or at least show it as disabled.
fields.summary: Edit Epic Link field - simple text edit interface

fields.description:
As of GH 6.2.1, the column width for issue detail view (while in Plan mode) is thinner than previous versions, and I've been hearing complaints about it.

GHS-2295 inspired me to write this, and I left a comment there. I wasn't sure if anyone would see it, so I created this. Feel free to close it if it's a duplicate. :)
fields.summary: Plan view - resizable issue details pane?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8775].
  {panel}

On a system with about 300 boards, it takes about 30 seconds for the the link *View On Board* to return a result.

h3. Diagnosis

When reviewing thread dumps (as per [Troubleshooting Performance Issues with Thread Dumps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Troubleshooting+Performance+Issues+with+Thread+Dumps]) taking during slow performance, the below stack traces can be found:

{noformat}
"http-bio-8080-exec-8436" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007f22dd940000 nid=0x6f6a runnable [0x00007f26184c5000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at org.apache.lucene.index.TermInfosReader.get(TermInfosReader.java:240)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.TermInfosReader.get(TermInfosReader.java:209)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.docFreq(SegmentReader.java:503)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.TermQuery$TermWeight$1.add(TermQuery.java:56)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.ReaderUtil$Gather.run(ReaderUtil.java:77)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.ReaderUtil$Gather.run(ReaderUtil.java:82)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.ReaderUtil$Gather.run(ReaderUtil.java:66)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.TermQuery$TermWeight.<init>(TermQuery.java:53)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.TermQuery.createWeight(TermQuery.java:198)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.<init>(BooleanQuery.java:176)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.createWeight(BooleanQuery.java:354)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.<init>(BooleanQuery.java:176)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.createWeight(BooleanQuery.java:354)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.<init>(BooleanQuery.java:176)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.createWeight(BooleanQuery.java:354)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.<init>(BooleanQuery.java:176)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.createWeight(BooleanQuery.java:354)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.<init>(BooleanQuery.java:176)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.createWeight(BooleanQuery.java:354)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$BooleanWeight.<init>(BooleanQuery.java:176)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.createWeight(BooleanQuery.java:354)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Searcher.createNormalizedWeight(Searcher.java:168)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.createNormalizedWeight(IndexSearcher.java:661)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:320)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHitCount(LuceneSearchProvider.java:247)

{noformat}

h3. Workaround:

Go to *Administration > Add-Ons > Manage Add-Ons > JIRA Agile* and disable {{greenhopper-agile-issue-web-panel}} to prevent display of this link. This will dissuade users from using this feature.
fields.summary: View on Board operation slow with large amount of boards

fields.description:
See the attached screen.  It would be nice to have the sub-task remaining estimates aggregated with the story remaining estimates in the card view of the work board (same way as it aggregates in issue detail view).

Right now, we estimate hours for sub-tasks, rather than stories, and rollup the hours from the sub-tasks to the stories.
fields.summary: As a user of Greenhopper I will see aggregated remaining estimates in Stories on my Work board.

fields.description:
Use case:
We use a scrum board with story (soon epic) swimlanes. All issues are required by our process to have subtasks so the actual planning order is respected despite the swimlanes. However, escalated tickets don't necessarily follow this process and must have maximum visiblity (production system down, integration test failure...). So we would like to have such issue on top of the board instead of the bottom no matter whether they have subtasks or not. Optimally, we would have special swimlanes for such issues.

Solution idea:
Allow at least one JQL query that overrides the swimlane setting that will still be used for all non-matching issues. Unclear to me how to best display if such issues have subtasks themselves again.
fields.summary: As an agile team we would like to see "certain" issue on top of a rapid board (using story swimlanes) to give them maximum visibility

fields.description:
When I transition last Sub-Task of an issue to Done status (Closed status in default configuration), GreenHopper pops up a window asking the user if he wants to transition also the parent issue. The same happens when I transition from Backlog to To Do status (to status Open in the default config).
Transitions of issues are independent from transitions of sub-tasks in our case. Our Jira users find it very annoying and sometimes even accidentally transition the parent issue.
Is there any way to disable the pop-up?

*Additional information:*
It would be great that we can control on which issue type(s) are allow to see the "Update Parent Issue" pop-up dialog.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to Disable "Update Parent Issue" pop-up

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This issue is another permutation of GHS-7984. As part of the GreenHopper upgrade, it creates duplicated managed fields and points GreenHopper configurations to the new fields. This presents with any of the following symptoms:

* Sprints vanish.
* Story Points no longer calculate correctly.
* Inability to rank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

We're not entirely sure how to accurately replicate the problem. If you find anything, *please let us know*!

h3. Expected Results

No duplicate fields are created upon upgrade.

h3. Actual Results

Duplicated fields are created and break a large amount of GreenHopper functionality.

h3. Notes

This can fixed as described in our [How to Fix the Duplicate GreenHopper Custom Fields After Upgrading|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/How+to+Fix+the+Duplicate+GreenHopper+Custom+Fields+After+Upgrading] KB article.
fields.summary: Duplicate Custom Fields created as part of a GreenHopper upgrade
Configure Working Days text should mention Control Chart

fields.description:
We have two agile teams working off of the same backlog using the Greenhopper Labs "Parallel Sprints" option enabled. This automatically adds a section on the top-left of the 'Work' agile board called 'Sprint Filters' which allow people to filter out stories by sprint. 

I am in the process of creating wallboards for each team, and unfortunately those sprint filters aren't being recognized by the gadget. I can add new quick filters to do this as a work-around, but then they'll show up on the agile board as well which is going to be confusing (since there are already filters for the same thing on the screen).
fields.summary: Allow Agile/Greenhopper Wallboard Gadget to use Sprint Filters
Parent issuekey does not strike-through after parent and sub-tasks are resolved in work mode.

fields.description:
Hi,

When user log work backdated on a issue, remaining estimate is not showing up correctly time tracking analysis or burn down chart. Could you please check and update. Attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Remaining estimate is not getting updated automatically in time tracking analysis or burn down chart
As a Manager I'd like version report gadget for wallboard so that milestone progress is visible

fields.description: It would make a good improvement to have the ability to define descriptions shown as tooltips for board objects, such as columns, swimlanes & quick filters.
fields.summary: Ability to define tooltips/descriptions for board objects

fields.description:
In GHS-3922, Tom Kotecki writes:
bq. "Please note that we have already implemented epic support..."

Epic support is not working well for me, nor are flat backlogs.

When we do the initial [work breakdown structure (WBS)|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Work_breakdown_structure] for a project, we enter all the items in a Structure with lots of hierarchy (using Epics and Stories: Epic -> Epic -> Epic -> ... -> Story). We use Epics for the hierarchy, and Stories are only used at the bottom. After we have our WBS, we do the sprint planning. To do the sprint planning based on the WBS, I need the Structure to be integrated with GreenHopper. Today, there is a mini Structure window in the right hand-side panel, and it shows the hierarchical Structure path to the issue highlighted on the rapid board. Instead of this, I need to see the entire Structure on one side of the screen (left), and the rapid board in planning mode on the other side (right). I want to be able to drag items from the Structure and drop them in a sprint on the rapid board in sprint planning mode.

Next, I will need the issues in the Structure to be visually annotated with the Sprint number they have been dragged into. This way, when I look at the Structure, I will know which issues have been planned and which have not been planned yet.

Other issues that might be related to this request:
GHS-2136
GHS-3922
GHS-5356
GHS-5667
GHS-7690
GHS-8044
JRA-29180
fields.summary: Integrate Structure and Sprint Planning

fields.description:
A visual way to see which features are 'Must Have', 'Should Have', 'Could Have' or 'Won't Have' following the MoSCoW format used when prioritising stories

A toggle viewable, draggable bar to segregate your stories into prioritised blocks. Zero, one or more of the bars could be present

Mocked up screenshot attached
fields.summary: add MoSCoW lines to Scrum planning boards

fields.description:
Preliminary notes: 
- I don't know if that is something you rather want to track in the GHS project or in the JRA project. Please feel free to move it, where it fits.
- In case I missed an existing story/feature request, please point me to that. Actually, I wasn't able to find one.

As a lot of our users switch to GreenHopper's SCRUM boards, what our users are looking for is to select a Sprint in the Statistic Type filed to generate a pie chart report based on the Sprint fields tracked in GreenHopper.
fields.summary: As a user, I can generate a Sprint based Pie Chart Report, so that I can fully utilize GreenHopper's Sprint concept

fields.description:
Preliminary notes: 
- I don't know if that is something you rather want to track in the GHS project or in the JRA project. Please feel free to move it, where it fits.
- In case I missed an existing story/feature request, please point me to that. Actually, I wasn't able to find one.

- I don't know if that is something you rather want to track in the GHS project or in the JRA project. Please feel free to move it, where it fits.

As a lot of our users switch to GreenHopper's SCRUM boards, what our users are looking for is to select a Sprint in the Statistic Type filed to generate a single level group by report based on the Sprint fields tracked in GreenHopper.

fields.description:
Because only keys of issues are provided in Burndown Chart report
each time you want to get the list of scope changes made in the sprint you need to open an issue. 
It would be great to have this information in the report itself.
fields.summary: Add Issue Type and Summary information on issue list in Burndown chart report

fields.description:
Preliminary notes: 
- I don't know if that is something you rather want to track in the GHS project or in the JRA project. Please feel free to move it, where it fits.
- In case I missed an existing story/feature request, please point me to that. Actually, I wasn't able to find one.

JIRAs Time Tracking Report (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Time+Tracking+Report) is an awesome report to check and improve on your (sub-taks level estimates). Unfortunately it is just based on JIRA's Version field.

As a lot of our users switch to GreenHopper's SCRUM boards, what our users are looking for is a choice to generate the report based on the Sprint fields tracked in GreenHopper.
fields.summary: As a user, I can generate a Sprint based Time Tracking Report similar to the existing version based Time Tracking Report, so that I can track my estimates accuracy
Reports causing horizontal scrollbar

Add a new API that exposes this information to be consumable in java

Hi,

We use a lot of version pre-planing for management, and allowing to use these versions (as it possible to do now in Scrum) will be a huge plus.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Allow pre-planning versions for Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Agile has a simplify workflow button, which puts the workflow into a special state that Agile expects it to be. Admins can modify the workflow through JIRA, which will put it into a state that means Agile can no longer use it. However, Agile can still offer to simplify the workflow. This can result in confusion and also generates errors when trying to simplify it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a project. Eg: TEST
# Create multiple issues in project TEST
# Create a board for this project and then change the workflow to Simplified Workflow Scheme in Agile
# Edit the workflow "Simplified Workflow Scheme" for project TEST.
# Edit the Draft and publish it. Eg: add new statuses and transition then, it appears as if the project TEST is not using Simplified Workflow Scheme in Agile
# Go to the board again.
# Click on the Simplified Workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The workflow can be simplified, or it lists 'Agile Simplified Workflow unavailable'.

h3. Actual Results

 It will hang and throw the following error:
{noformat}
2015-06-26 03:55:52,035 http-bio-8080-exec-24922 ERROR jirasupport 235x11196994x1 1jkdqme 10.125.72.11,127.0.0.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/workflow/convert.json [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: The workflow is assigned to workflow schemes
com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: The workflow is assigned to workflow schemes
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.deleteWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:495)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor13492.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy385.deleteWorkflow(Unknown Source)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:154)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy385.deleteWorkflow(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.workflow.WorkflowServiceImpl.deleteWorkflow(WorkflowServiceImpl.java:312)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.workflow.SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.deleteExistingNamedEntitiesIfNecessary(SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.java:893)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.workflow.SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.createSimplifiedWorkflowForExistingProject(SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.java:547)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.WorkflowResource$5.call(WorkflowResource.java:330)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.WorkflowResource$5.call(WorkflowResource.java:312)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.createResponse(AbstractResource.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.WorkflowResource.convertWorkflow(WorkflowResource.java:311)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Edit the workflow again and make sure all the status have the option "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" marked and then publish the workflow.
When you get to the board columns configuration you should see this message "Using Simplified Workflow" indicating that the workflow is considered "simplified" by JIRA again.
fields.summary: Editing the JIRA Agile simplified workflow enables the Simplify workflow button

fields.description: The swimlane is 'selected' but it does not scroll into view.
fields.summary: When a parent issue swimlane is selected and the page is refreshed, it should scroll to that swimlane
Improve rendering of default date fields in detail view
